title: constant spikes, maybe packet loss
body:
ive been getting this problem more regularly now and i thought it was ddos. my mates thought it was that too, but im starting to wonder now, i come across this youtube lin that i linked here and when he gets is the same as what i get, everything he explains is pretty much it. what do i do? ive restarted the router already.

www.youtube.com/watch?v=SyxreIU1P74

replies.body: You could also try http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/ to test your internet connection. Synopsis is at the top.

ill try that link u posted in a min, i had a few games over the last few days and hadnt had the problem, so i thought maybe i was unlucky and its all good now, but just then i played a game and it happened again, i lost about 13 mins of the start then came good but the damage was done, after our loss i got a leave buster thing for the next 5 games on a lower prioty que, thats whats pissed me off now
and also i reformatted my PC just before that game too so theres nothing but league on the PC atm

>and also i reformatted my PC just before that game too

To format your PC is to remove (permanently) all data on every single device connected to it, which will not only destroy all data on your hard-drive but brick your system, so that it can't be used for anything aside from being a weight. At the least, if you just format your hard-drive, you'd at least still be able to install another operating system onto it, to start over without any existing data.

I think you probably mean something along the lines of defragmentation or optimisation, neither of which will fix underlying problems such as corrupt files or changed dependencies.

Have you tried repairing the client? It takes a while, arguably, but it reduces the chance of the issue being local significantly.

formating for what i did was boot with window CD in, and formated that patition that ran the system, so everything got wiped as intended coz i had this anoying hidded bug i couldnt get rid of in my browser it was called istartsurf or something, very anoying popups even with popup blocker, but anyways thats how i formatted anyways, i had to reinstall league and google chrome, thats all ive got so far on.

Ah, I usually say that as "format and reinstalled my OS". Sorry for the misunderstanding!

Are you still getting these sorts of lag issues when playing League?

the day i  "format and reinstalled my OS" i played a game and copped it again, half way through people said to try disable firewall or reset modem so i turned off firewall and reloaded league and it seemed to work, so i thought thats it i found the problem. So i played another game and it happened again, same spot, just as jungle minion spawn, thats when it seems to happen, and coz of that i stole the kill and he raged lol, but anyways half the game it was like that then it came good,  after that i got a leave buster thing and got placed on 5 min wait for ques.
so i had a few days break and came back and tryed again and had perfect game, so who knows, mystery

http://i.imgur.com/vbcjGnT.png

For the ages. If it starts again, contact me.
so i brought brand new modem, and a few games it was good, but just now its doing it again
Have you checked to see if you disabled Windows automatic maintenance? Eg. Windows Update.

i checked, its on update automaticly.
after my last disconnect i copped a leave buster and now next 5 games have 10 min waits, im over it for something out of my controll, when i think ive nailed the problem ill get a few clean games in and think its fine then it hits me again, so over the time ive got the leave buster crap, the other week i had the 5 min wait before que and now its gone to 10 mins.

Have you tried turning off automatic updates? Windows automatic services will also cause problems such as this.

Have you had any success with using the Berkeley Institute's self diagnosis program?
i tryed the link, it wont do anything, i dont understand, also ping test needs java so i installed that again but still tells me i need java, im so pissed off now

It's a tool provided by a university, and thus it *is* open to bugs. But on usual use, it shouldn't break, as it's a relatively simple program, compared to other things such as Youtube and Facebook.

Have you enabled Java in your browser add-ons page? You may have to do that, because it's mostly set to the default option of being 'disabled'. In addition, did you reset your computer after installing?

so ii found out how to enable java, and still dont work, so i tryed to do it in explorer, and the page wont fully load up, or any page for that matter.
i feel defeated, i just out of options now and its really pissing me off, im scared now to even que up for a game now since i copped a leave buster with low prioity ques, whats next? 3 day ban or something, who knows

If your internet browser is failing to load pages that it should have no trouble with, do you think maybe this might be a more external problem? Are your cables all fitted correctly? Are you using data off-peak?

Is your computer infected with a virus?
pages will stll load fine and ill still be talking to mates on curse voice

Try it now.

Maybe it fixed itself.

If you really want to test this, reinstall Java.

start at http://pingtest.net
you will need to enable Java for the packet loss test
